conclusion: Diffraction is the bending of light waves around edges, more for longer wavelengths.
Refractive index is inversely proportional to wavelength; higher frequency light bends more.
Light beams a and b are incident perpendicularly onto the flat surface AB of the glass brick.
Since light b is more likely to exhibit diffraction, it has a longer wavelength than light a.
Light b has a longer wavelength and lower frequency than light a.
